Text: For the choirmaster. Of David. To bring to remembrance.
Context: This is an introduction and it indicates that the Psalm is meant for the choirmaster and it is by David, intended for bringing something to remembrance.

Text: Make haste, O God, to deliver me; O LORD, make haste to help me.
Context: The psalmist is in urgent need of deliverance and is calling upon God for immediate help.

Text: May those who seek my life be put to shame and confounded; may all who desire my harm be turned back and humiliated.
Context: The psalmist wishes that those who seek his harm would be shamed and thwarted in their plans.

Text: May those who say, "Aha, aha!" turn back in their own shame.
Context: The psalmist is expressing a desire for those who mock and revel in his troubles to be embarrassed and defeated.

Text: May all who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; may those who love Your salvation always say, "God is great!"
Context: Amidst the psalmist's troubles, there is a call for those who seek God and cherish His salvation to be joyful and to exclaim God's greatness.

Text: Yet I am poor and needy; hurry to me, O God. You are my help and my deliverer; O LORD, do not delay.
Context: The psalmist acknowledges his vulnerable state and reiterates his urgent plea for God's assistance, affirming his dependence on God's timely intervention.
